newsitem.title: CHINA: China sets 10 bln yuan 1996 share issue ceiling.
newsitem.headline: China sets 10 bln yuan 1996 share issue ceiling.

text.p: China's Securities Commission under the State Council, or cabinet, announced on Sunday a quota of 10 billion yuan worth of share issues for 1996, the Xinhua news agency said.
The figure is 200 percent larger than the quota for 1995, it said.
The quota, if unused by the end of 1996, could be carried over into the following year.
The decision is aimed mainly at supporting the pillar large and medium-size state enterprises to which the State Council has decided to give its support, it said.
The China Securities Regulatory Commission, China's top watchdog, will restrict the number of companies that will be allowed to list.
The report did not specify whether the quota included both foreign currency B shares and domestic A shares.
